measured_by: Reinforcement Learning risk-taking task (choice proportion of risky stimulus S2 vs. sure S3)
justification: "In this setting, the measure of risk sensitivity is given by the proportion of times a participant chose the risky stimulus S2 when S3 was presented as the alternative."

measured_by: Holt & Laury multiple-price-list gamble task (number of safe choices)
justification: "The number of times the participant chose Gamble A over Gamble B … can thus be used as a continuous measure of risk sensitivity ranging from highly risk loving to highly risk averse."
"Participants evaluated 30 activities … The measure of risk sensitivity is given by the estimated b coefficient, with b < 0 indicating risk aversion and b > 0 indicating risk seeking."
